results.title: Miscarriage
results.brief_description: Miscarriage is an extremely common event but for many women it is an unexpected shock from which they may take many years to recover. The sense of failure and feelings of guilt often experienced after a miscarriage can have devastating and influential roles on lives and marriages. This film, co-written by G.P. Dr. Anne McPherson, and sociologist, Ann Oakley, sets out to de-mystify miscarriage through the experiences of women who have had one.

results.title: Mirror image = Ming dai zhui zhu
results.creator_credit: Hsiao Ya-chuan, Hsien Ping Han, Lumen Films, Asiatic Films, Sinomovie and Chang Shu A&V Production
results.brief_description: After his father has a stroke, Tung-chin (Lee Jiunn-Jye) finds himself in charge of the family business, a pawnshop. He is kept company by his girlfriend Eiko, a woman he met on the Internet when he went by the name of “No-line”, the origins of which are revealed: 3 months ago he fell from his scooter, scarring his hand and removing all traces of lines. He now considers himself free from the fate life has dealt him and dictated by circumstance. Eiko is determined to recover an image of his palm and restore his future. The majority of the film takes place in the shop, the couple’s ennui punctuated by card playing, dancing, and reading the palms of their customers once they manage to convince them that it’s a legal requirement. No-line meets a woman called I Know and they begin travelling the subway together hocking items from the store. A collaborator of Hou Hsiao-Hsien, Hsiao Ya-chuan’s feature film debut gestures to Wong Kar-Wai and is a quirky tale of limited locales about manipulation, fate and the inability to avoid it. Satisfying in visuals rather than in the content it is exploring, the film was well received by critics in the Taipai Film Festival (2000) and Vancouver International Film Festival (2001): the director considered one of Taiwan’s emerging talents. Executive producers: Hou Hsiao-hsien, Hwrng Wern-Ying. In Mandarin and Taiwanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Martin Arnold: cinemnesis
results.brief_description: Martin Arnold is a contemporary Austrian experimental filmmaker. His short films make use of familiar Hollywood footage put through an optical printer to create effects of jarring, twitching and rhythmic vision. The sequence is stoped and started over and over from one frame and incrementally moves slowly ahead in a jumping fashion. The effect is nervous and jumpy and allows the viewer to contemplate further in an abstract fashion the notion of film and the ideas of memory and machinery. The ideas of Freud along with other thinkers like Derrida have informed the filmmaker. Ideas about memory and what is etched into the brain being in fact a vision which is clear and yet highly effected by emotions, places and thoughts. Displacing and decontextualising recognisable found footage causes the stable and reassuring images to become mildly disturbing. The human condition becomes technical and the nature of film is altered as what we thought of as mundane and everyday is oddly out of context. These short films are interesting and at the same time cause a mild discomfort.

results.title: Martha
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder and Peter Marthesheimer
results.brief_description: After Martha Heyer’s tyrannical father dies suddenly during their holiday in Italy, she meets and is proposed to by engineer Helmut Salomon, who sweeps her off her feet with a disturbing mixture of romance and intimidation. After their marriage Helmut’s behaviour becomes increasingly oppressive and Martha’s ever more fearful and desperate to please, as the film builds to a truly horrific climax. Whether taken as a psychological horror movie or as the blackest of black comedies, this is undoubtedly the most extreme and alarming of all of Fassbinder’s visions of married life. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Marsupials: Naturally the numbat
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, John Shaw and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: You mean a wombat don’t you? is the usual reaction but a numbat is quite different - smaller than a cat, with a long pointed nose and a striped back. Numbats live inside hollow logs in densely wooded areas, and eat termites. Includes feeding scenes and close-ups of young numbats.

results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Franco and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).

results.title: On stage
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Follows a community group in the production of a play from initial casting auditions to the final actual performance. Attempts to give, through its explanatory commentary, an overall view of typical amateur activities and a few hints on common theatrical and organisational problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Dick, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Magic Flute
results.creator_credit: Gayle Thomas, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Lyrical animation of the magical events which occur when various children play a flute, evoking both pleasant scenes of flowers and unpleasant ones of witches and bats, according to the personality of the child. Sound film without words. (Awards: Palo Alto; Columbus)
